answers.text:
Salt Lake City, Utah, along with the Salt Lake Chamber of Commerce, and the Salt Lake Downtown Alliance created the position of Downtown Ombudsman a few years ago when the City Creek development in downtown started.
The Downtown Ombudsman works with business owners to help minimize the impact of the construction. 
For more information you can contact Salt Lake City's Community and Economic Development Department at 801-535-6230, or the Salt Lake Chamber of Commerce.
I hope this helps.

author: Kimball Payne
text: Are there any model progrms to address impacts on local businesses during major utilities and streetscape improvement projects?  This is an issue that we are increasingly hearing about, even more so during the recession.  The City is starting to plan for the replacement of 100 year old water infrastructure in its central business district and is looking for innovative programs to support local businesses during the construction period.
title: Addressing Business Distruption During Utilities Projects
